emerging_technologies.name: Neural Swarm Intelligence
emerging_technologies.description: A collective intelligence formed by interconnected neural interfaces, allowing for real-time, large-scale problem solving and decision making.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for increased efficiency in decision-making but raises concerns about privacy and the autonomy of individual thought.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Dependent on advancements in neural tech and acceptance of brain-computer interfaces in daily life.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: A blockchain system leveraging quantum computing for enhanced security, enabling unbreakable encryption and faster transaction processing.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could revolutionize financial systems, secure communications, and data integrity, but requires significant computational infrastructure.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Widespread adoption hinges on the maturity of quantum computing and regulatory acceptance.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Planning
emerging_technologies.description: AI-driven systems for real-time urban development planning, optimizing for sustainability and efficiency.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to more sustainable cities but might face resistance from traditional urban planning bodies.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will depend on governmental policies, public acceptance, and proof of concept through pilot projects.

emerging_technologies.name: Martian Resource Extraction
emerging_technologies.description: Robotic systems designed to extract resources like water, minerals, and gases on Mars for use in colonization efforts.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Paves the way for self-sustaining Martian colonies, but requires overcoming significant technical challenges.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Dependent on the success of Mars missions and the economic viability of extraterrestrial mining.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Driven Software Development
mainstream_technologies.description: AI systems that not only assist but also autonomously develop software, reducing human involvement in coding.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in tech industries, leading to increased productivity but also concerns about job displacement.

mainstream_technologies.name: Personalized Medicine via AI
mainstream_technologies.description: AI algorithms analyze individual genetic data to tailor medical treatments, leading to more effective and personalized healthcare.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming standard in healthcare, with significant regulatory frameworks to ensure ethical use of genetic data.

epoch_themes.description: Advancements in neural interfaces and AI leading to deeper integration between human cognition and technology.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Raises questions about the nature of consciousness, privacy, and the ethical implications of cognitive enhancement.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased focus on neuroethics, regulation of cognitive technologies, and societal debates on the limits of human enhancement.

epoch_themes.description: Technologies aimed at making urban environments more sustainable through autonomous systems and AI.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes environmental resilience and quality of life in cities, but could face pushback from traditional urban development stakeholders.
epoch_themes.global_trends: A push towards smart cities, green infrastructure, and circular economy models.
